title: Embodied Learning Program for Computational Thinking and Mathematical Understanding

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary mathematical computation skills and understanding of simple programming concepts
context.additional_context: Project-based course solving real-life math problems by integrating embodied activities (e.g., physical movements, manipulatives) with computational thinking (e.g., algorithm design, pattern analysis)

learning_goals: Learners can solve problems with over 80% accuracy by applying computational perspectives (pattern recognition, abstraction, algorithm design) during mathematical problem-solving
Learners can represent mathematical concepts (e.g., functions, geometry) in three or more ways through embodied activities (e.g., physical movement, physical modeling)
Learners can produce integrated outcomes connecting mathematical problems with programming concepts through project-based assessments and incorporate peer feedback
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
